result.execSummary:
The defendant Romeo Hammer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
The defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons to include but not limited to knives, brass knuckles and/or firearms.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. The Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the brass knuckles seized in Waushara County Case No. 16CM436.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Time served sentence with credit for 30 days of prior time served.

Court Costs are reimposed in the amount of $443.00.  Court Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Romeo Hammer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 17CF-104, 17CM-92 and 16CM-123 - All Cases Called @ 10:20 AM: Defendant Romeo Hammer in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel will stipulate to 69 days TS credit globally.  DA recites recommendation as to SEHR's cases.  State will move for amendment of Ct 1 to allow for potential expungement.  Argued terms expected on Restitution amount, etc.  17CF-104:    Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Counsel and Def will stipulate to facts to allow for amendment of charge.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed - victim present. Court accepts State's motion to Amend Ct 1 to Felony Theft as PTAC (Class H), contrary to s. 943.20(3)(bm) Plea Ct 1 w/PTAC:  NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Amendment supports best interests for Def to allow for potential expungement. Counsel admit receipt of ROAW.  No factual or materials errors offered.  Chapter 950 in compliance.  Statement by Victim prior to SEH.  16CM-123/17CM-92 - Argument by DA as to SEHR and 17CF-104.  Argument by SPD as to SEHR and 17CF-104, argues for lesser conditional jail.  Counsel expect to resolve the items disputed in Updated Rest Summary with victim present today.  Statement by Def:  Apologizes to victim.  The Court:   Accepts recommendations made - 16CM-123:  30 days WCJ, 30 days TS credit - time served SEH, Court Costs reimposed - 60 DTP.  17CM-92:  6 mos WCJ as to Ct 1, 6 mos WCJ as to Ct 2 - concurrent to one another and concurrent to 16CM-123 with 69 TS credit.  17CF-104:  Opportunity to expunge under s 973.015 if successfully discharged from probation and all conditions of supervision successfully completed for the Court to determine as successful discharge and expungement.  S/W - 3 yrs probation.  Conditions:  120 days conditional jail time, consecutive to any existing SEH.  Expungement to be earned by Def.  Work Release, no TS credit and no GT.  Restitution TBD.  AODA and any follow thru as deemed appropriate.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Not to incur any PO Holds that result in a new criminal offenses, No contact with co-def Adam Carey (Alferftig); No contact with J. Zamzow; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.   DNA Sample (on file) and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Victim sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA.  Ex 1 marked - Updated Restitution Summary.  Ex 2 marked - Receipt for Camera.  Ex 2 entered and received.  Ex 1 entered and received.  Cross-Exam by SPD.  Argument by DA as to Restitution.  Argument by SPD as to Restitution.  The Court:  In light of suggested review of case law brought forth by the Court, counsel suggest the Court order Restitution today.  Court orders total Restitution of  $130.00 (last 3 items noted on summary)  together with due to lack of required nexus not being established. Restitution to be repaid in increments of not less than $50 monthly and to commence on the 1st of the month - one full month removed from incarceration.
from the DE to the Court
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.

16CM123, 16CM436 & 17CM92 Cases called @ 2:28 p.m. Defendant Romeo Hammer in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM123 - DE admits that a violation has occurred. The Court sets the agreement aside and enters JOC.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 17CM92: Cts 1 & 3 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 17CM92: Cts 2 & 4 - DRI. 16CM436 - DRI. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi - requesting expungment. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson - voices an objection to the opportunity for expungment. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - 1 day CFTS in the event of a revocation - Conditions: AODA and follow through,  DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons including but not limited to knives, brass knuckles and/or firearms, the Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the brass knuckles, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  No opportunity for expungment on 16CM123. 17CM92 - Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015. Appeal rights given.
Motion hearing on May 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests plea/sentencing.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on March 31, 2017 at 01:50 pm.

16CM123, 16CM436 & 17CM92 Cases called @ 3:05 p.m. Defendant Romeo Hammer in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 17CM92 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Defendant will be represented by SPD.  NGP entered. DA Blader requesting a $1500 signature bond.  No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled as to all cases for March 31, 2017 at 01:50 pm.
Status conference on February 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Case Called @ 3:12 PM: Defendant Romeo Hammer in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  States he has just recently been appointed and Discovery Demand filed today.  Offer letter received but add'l time request for consideration.  No objection by ADA.  The Court:  Will continue the order tolling any time limitations as to 16CM-123.  STC adjourned as requested.  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on January 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

16CM123 & 16CM436 Cases called @ 2:10 p.m. Defendant Romeo Hammer in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court withdraws the warrants previously issued. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No statement by DE.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint. The Court continues to toll the time limits in the Post Plea Diversion Agreement in 16CM123.  Status conference scheduled for January 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Voluntary appearance on January 5, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Case called @ 2:17 p.m. Defendant Romeo Hammer in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and stays JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 12 months. The Court reminds the defendant that the bond remains in effect throughout the pendency of the PPDA.
